75006.local_reputation: Diverse, middle-class, and culturally mixed. Carrollton 75006 has pockets that lean more conservative and others that are younger, more international, and moderate. Generally viewed as balanced.

75007.local_reputation: Family-friendly, moderate, and culturally mixed. More suburban than 75006, with a blend of long-time residents and younger families. Considered politically even-tempered.

75010.local_reputation: A blend of suburban Carrollton and fast-growing The Colony. Skews moderately conservative but with rapidly increasing diversity and younger families, so it feels balanced-to-slightly-red.

75013.local_reputation: Higher-income, more diverse, and more moderate than east Allen. Considered balanced and family-focused, with strong schools and active neighborhoods.

75019.local_reputation: Wealthy, highly educated, and traditionally conservative but trending more moderate among younger families. Known for strong schools and high civic involvement.

75024.local_reputation: High-income, corporate, and internationally diverse. Traditionally conservative but shifting toward moderate professional-suburban as more tech workers and transplants move in.

75025.local_reputation: Family-focused, safe, and diverse. Reputation is moderate, with a blend of long-time conservative homeowners and newer professional households leaning centrist.

75034.local_reputation: Affluent, family-oriented, and historically conservative, especially around The Star and west Frisco. Increasingly mixed as more corporate transplants arrive, but still feels slightly right-of-center.

75035.local_reputation: Younger, fast-growing, and community-oriented. Known as more moderate than west Frisco, with a balanced reputation and strong school involvement.

75067.local_reputation: Very diverse, mixed-income, and culturally moderate. Has both working-class roots and young professionals. Widely seen as one of the more politically mixed suburbs in North Dallas.

75070.local_reputation: Balanced suburban culture, diverse demographics, and a moderate reputation. Not seen as strongly right or left, with a mix of newer and older neighborhoods.

75072.local_reputation: Upscale, master-planned neighborhoods with golf courses and HOAs. Reputation is center-right but more balanced than Prosper. Very community- and school-oriented.

75077.local_reputation: Family-heavy, higher-income, and leans conservative culturally. Strong school engagement and traditional suburban norms, with a quieter, established feel.

75078.local_reputation: Very family-focused, affluent, and strongly conservative culturally. Known for large new-construction homes, church life, and traditional values that attract many relocating families.

75080.local_reputation: Extremely diverse, with a strong international and tech community linked to UTD. Politically mixed-to-moderate and known for being pragmatic and culturally blended.

75081.local_reputation: Similar to 75080 but more residential and family-heavy. Very balanced culturally, with a mix of long-time residents and newer immigrant families.

75082.local_reputation: Tech-heavy, highly educated, and internationally diverse. Considered politically moderate and globally minded, with many students and professionals.

75093.local_reputation: Wealthy, corporate, and traditionally conservative, especially near the Legacy corridor. Becoming more centrist as tech, healthcare, and international residents grow.

75038.local_reputation: Urban-suburban blend with high-rise condos and corporate headquarters. Very diverse and professionally-oriented. Feels more moderate and international than traditional suburbs.

75039.local_reputation: Higher-end Las Colinas with lakefront properties and corporate campuses. Diverse, educated, and moderate-leaning with a mix of professionals and families.

75062.local_reputation: Very diverse and working-to-middle-class. More affordable than surrounding areas. Culturally mixed with a moderate-to-slightly-left lean in recent elections.

75234.local_reputation: Traditional suburban with increasing diversity. Has both older established neighborhoods and newer developments. Generally moderate with a slight conservative lean.

75244.local_reputation: Near Addison and the Galleria area. More urban feel than typical suburbs. Diverse, younger professional population. Considered moderate-to-mixed politically.

75009.local_reputation: Rapidly growing from rural to suburban. Still holds traditional small-town conservative values but changing fast as new developments bring younger families from across DFW.

76092.local_reputation: Very affluent, highly educated, and strongly conservative culturally. Known for traditional values, intense school pride, and some of the most right-leaning school board and city politics in DFW.

76034.local_reputation: Affluent, established, and culturally conservative. Known for large homes, church-centered community life, and a reputation as one of the more right-leaning suburbs in Tarrant County.

75052.local_reputation: Very diverse and working-to-middle-class. Strong Hispanic and Asian communities. More affordable and considered moderate-to-slightly-left leaning in recent years.
